articles.title: International solidarity with Korean people
articles.content:
International solidarity with Korean people
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Meetings for opening the month of international solidarity with the Korean people were held at the Mashina District Committee Conference Hall of the People's Rally for Socialism of Democratic Congo, the Conakry People's Palace of Guinea and in Antony of France  over June 25-27.
   The General Secretary of the People's Rally for Socialism of Democratic Congo said the korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War was a victory of President Kim Il Sung's distinguished military idea, strategy and tactics and great war method and a brilliant result of mass heroism displayed by the army and people.
   The Chairman of the Guinean committee for supporting Korea's reunification said the Guinean government and people fully support the most reasonable ways for early reunification of Korea set forth by  leader of the Korean people Kim Jong Il in his work on April 18.
   The Secretary General of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea, in a speech lashed out at the U.S. troops' occupation of South Korea and the successive South Korean rulers' separatist moves. And he demanded that the "National Security Law"  be abolished and the "Agency for National Security Planning" of South Korea be dissolved.

articles.title: South Korea's FKTU decides to hold mass rally
articles.content:
South Korea's FKTU decides to hold mass rally
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The Federation of (South) Korean Trade Unions (FKTU) called an emergaency conference on July 1. 
   At the conference the federation decided to hold a large rally against the  forcible structural reform by the puppet authorities on July 10, in unity with the (South) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, according to a report from Seoul.
   It demanded that the authorities ensure jobs for workers of the five banks which are to be closed and stop the unilateral structural reform of public sectors.
   The federation will not take part in the "labour-management-government committee" but stage a strong, anti-"government" struggle unless its demands are met, it warned.

articles.title: Senior party and government officials visit Jagang Province
articles.content:
Senior party and government officials visit Jagang Province
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, Kye Ung Thae, Han Song Ryong and other senior party and government officials, leading officials of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee, commissions and ministries of the administration council and national institutions visited different units of the national economy in Jagang Province on July 2 and 3.
   Officials and working people in Jagang Province have done a lot of things through their vigorous struggle  in a matter of five months under the banner of self-reliance, in response to the tasks given by General Kim Jong Il  in his on-the-spot guidance to Jagang Province in January.
   Participants visited different units along the course of his on-the-spot guidance, experiencing his noble traits of devoting himself to the prosperity of the country and happiness.
   Achievements in  the construction of minor power stations drew their attention.

articles.title: "Plan for army reform" announced in S. Korea
articles.content:
"Plan for army reform" announced in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The traitorous "government of people" of South Korea on July 2 announced a "plan for army reform"  allegedly to unify the puppet army commanding system, according to a radio report from Seoul.
   Under the plan, the field army commands of the 1st and 3rd army corps, now deployed in the forefront areas, will be merged into the ground operation command. And the 2nd army corps command is to be reformed into a logistic command while the command rooms of the first, second and third army corps in the puppet army headquarters will be unified into a headquarters command room.
   The puppets also decided to integrate intelligence units allegedly for "effective support" to joint operations, transform the transport  operation system and reduce the present 38-stage "decision-making process" to 24-stage one.
   Never should it go unnoticed that the puppets' steps for unifying the army commanding system have been  taken to keep pace with the U.S. imperialists, their master, in the moves to ignite a war against the north.

articles.title: Reception given at Syrian embassy
articles.content:
Reception given at Syrian embassy
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Bassam Al-Haj H1111in, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy here, gave a reception on July 4 in connection with the signing of Juche 87-Juche 89 (1998-2000) plan for executing the cultural agreement between the DPRK and Syrian governments.
   Invited to the reception were Mun Jae Chol, acting Chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and other officials concerned.
   Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: 2nd meeting of preparatory comm. of August 15 grand reunification-oriented festival
articles.content:
2nd meeting of preparatory comm. of August 15 grand reunification-oriented festival 
  Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The second meeting of the preparatory committee of a grand festival for national reconciliation, unity and reunification was held in Pyongyang on July 3.
   Discussed at the meeting were the process of the preparations for the festival and follow-up measures, especially a matter to provide against schemings of the South Korean government authorities who are trying to keep the south headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification (Pomminryon) and the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) from participating in the festival as the preceding dictatorial "regimes" did.
   It was said at the meeting that the festival should be participated in by all political parties and organisations in South Korea and abroad, and Pomminryon and Hanchongryon that have led the August 15 Pan-Korea Rally and other joint reunification-oriented functions of people in the north, south and abroad and reunification movement should play a pivotal role to this end.
   It was also said that the South Korean authorities should unconditionally allow Pomminryon south headquarters and Hanchongryon to take part in the festival, abolish the "National Security Law,"  dismantle the "Agency for National Security Planning" and work hard to create an atmosphere helpful to the festival, and that this is a position north Korea has always maintained.
   It was unanimously stressed that for a peaceful holding of the festival reunification movement  organisations and democrats in South Korea should set themselves against the fascist suppression on the part of the government authorities and conduct a powerful solidarity struggle for the participation of Pomminryon south headquarters and Hanchongryon in the festival.
    Measures for pushing ahead with preparations for the festival were adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Dangerous war confab
articles.content:
Dangerous war confab
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) --Papers here today describe the recent "South Korea-Japan Consultative Meeting on Security Policy" in Seoul as a dangerous war confab.
   The meeting had discussions on matters of "building confidence" in security and  "guaranteeing transparency" in military field and  of the participation of South Korea in consultations for carrying into practice "guidelines for U.S.-Japan Defence Cooperation". This is a dangerous move to tighten the U.S.-Japan-South Korea triangular military alliance, says Rodong Sinmun.
   The news analyst says:
   With the tightened military tieup between Japan and the South Korean puppets and triangular military alliance the danger of a war is hourly growing stronger on the Korean peninsula.
   We cannot remain a passive onlooker to these developments.
   The Korean People's Army and people are following with sharpened vigilance the anti-DPRK war manoeuvrings of the Japanese reactionaries and the South Korean puppets.
   Minju Joson describes the South Korea-Japan consultative meeting as a bargain between the traitors to the nation and their master.
   The Korean people will never tolerate the flunkeyist treacheries of the South Korean government authorities who are working hard to bring into shape the triangular military alliance, it adds.
